title: 06x12: Filing an Amicus Curiae Brief on Behalf of Affiliate of Labor Organization
summary: Government employees are generally prohibited from acting as agent or attorney for anyone before a Federal court in connection with any covered matter in which the U.S. is a party or has a direct and substantial interest. 18 U.S.C. § 205(i) provides an exception for representing a "labor organization" under certain conditions.
